name: Bypass Capacitor
description: Used to filter out high-frequency noise in electronic circuits.

name: Electrolytic Capacitor
description: Stores electrical energy, commonly used for filtering and power supply smoothing.

name: Integrated Micro Circuit
description: Performs electronic functions such as amplification, computation, and signal processing in a compact form.

name: LED
description: Emits light when an electric current passes through it, used for indication and illumination.

name: PNP Transistor
description: A type of bipolar junction transistor used for amplification and switching.

name: Armature
description: The rotating part of an electric motor or generator that carries current.

name: Attenuator
description: Reduces the amplitude or power of a signal without distorting its waveform.

name: Cartridge Fuse
description: Protects electrical circuits by breaking the connection if the current exceeds a safe level.

name: Clip Lead
description: Used to make temporary electrical connections for testing or prototyping.

name: Electric Relay
description: Electrically operated switch used to control a circuit by a separate low-power signal.

name: Filament
description: A wire that produces light when heated by an electric current, as in light bulbs.

name: Heat Sink
description: Dissipates heat from electronic components to prevent overheating.

name: Induction Coil
description: Produces high-voltage pulses from a low-voltage direct current supply.

name: Jumper Cable
description: Connects electronic components or circuits temporarily for testing or prototyping.

name: Junction Transistor
description: Used for amplification and switching in electronic circuits.

name: Light Circuit
description: Controls or distributes electrical power to lighting devices.

name: Limiter Clipper
description: Limits or clips the amplitude of a signal to a specified level.

name: Local Oscillator
description: Generates a periodic oscillating signal for use in radio and electronic circuits.

name: Memory Chip
description: Stores digital data for use in computers and electronic devices.

name: Microchip
description: Performs a variety of electronic functions in a compact, integrated form.

name: Microprocessor
description: Acts as the central processing unit (CPU) of a computer, executing instructions.

name: Multiplexer
description: Selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output line.

name: Omni-Directional Antenna
description: Radiates or receives radio waves uniformly in all directions.

name: Potential Divider
description: Divides the input voltage into smaller voltages using resistors.

name: Potentiometer
description: A variable resistor used to adjust voltage or signal levels.

name: Pulse Generator
description: Generates electrical pulses of defined width and frequency.

name: Relay
description: Electrically operated switch used to control circuits.

name: Rheostat
description: A variable resistor used to control current flow.

name: Semi-Conductor
description: Material with electrical conductivity between a conductor and an insulator, used in electronic devices.

name: Semiconductor Diode
description: Allows current to flow in only one direction, used for rectification.

name: Shunt
description: Provides a low-resistance path for electric current to bypass another point in the circuit.

name: Solenoid
description: A coil of wire that generates a magnetic field when current passes through it.

name: Stabilizer
description: Maintains a constant voltage level to protect electrical devices from voltage fluctuations.

name: Step-Down Transformer
description: Reduces high voltage to a lower voltage suitable for use in electronic circuits.

name: Step-Up Transformer
description: Increases low voltage to a higher voltage for specific applications.

name: Transistor
description: Acts as a switch or amplifier in electronic circuits.
